comment: Semantically close to aorist.
translation as in source: {Чтобы не шел град, в селе проводят ритуал: обводят барана вокруг границы села. Однажды барана не обводили.} ‘Один раз нас побило градом.’

comment: Formed with a participialized form of the Perfect, has a weak inferential meaning.
translation as in source: Наш город был основан (букв. построили) в 1550 году.

form:aux_source_label: локативный стативный глагол настоящего; ‘быть, находиться внутри’
example_as_in_source: wa… ge k’ʷal-as š.u-naa ze gi-jči, aχrːa ʁ.a-s-e zun gi-n tːur
translation as in source: {В Курахе жил мужчина по имени Абдулвахаб. А у нас в Хпюке его называли…} Нет... я забыл как (букв. из моей памяти ушло), потом скажу, как его называли.
gloss_source: нет demg в_памяти-elat уходить.pf-res мой что-indef потом говорить.ipf-inf-cop я demg-gen имя
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

translation as in source: The shepherd (reportedly) had killed a sheep.
example_comment: Source actually uses macron for geminate consonants.

comment: The distribution of allomorphs used to form the General Converb is described in Creissels (2012), also referenced under “Source”.
translation as in source: The shepherd has killed a sheep.
example_comment: Source actually uses macron for geminate consonants.

comment: Called прошедшее заглазное in source, but example given of resultative.
translation as in source: открыто (букв. “открыв есть”)

gloss_source: Der Vater (Erg) den Feind (Nom) tötete offenbar.
example_comment: Original examples uses macrons for geminate consonants; example of indirect evidentiality

translation as in source: He has woken up.
example_comment: Example of resultative.

translation as in source: I have opened the window (i.e. it is now open).
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

translation as in source: The woman is still sleeping.
example_comment: Original source is different; example shows resultative meaning, which can occur with or without the copula.

translation as in source: The sheep that you gave me turned out to be restless (lit. It appears that you have me sheep not having order.)
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality; there is some weird symbol on the k in ko-li, but I can’t find it.

comment: Auxiliary has different forms for different persons.
example_as_in_source: J̌ragrakan c’anc’-n aṙavel zargac’-ac ē barjr leṙnayin goti-ner-um.
translation as in source: The hydrographic net is more developed in high mountainous zones.
gloss_source: water net.nom-the more develop-ptcp.res. it is high mountainous zone-pl-loc

comment: It seems the unwitnessed meaning requires some “reinforcement” from other elements, see Kozintseva (2000: 410), though Kozintseva considers the form to have indirect evidential meaning; Auxiliary has different forms for different persons.
example_as_in_source: tanә morә xndrel1 ē2 darmanel is stacac verk’erә ew erb verk’erә lavacel3 en4 noric ē bax-el Maṙanc dinerә
translation as in source: At home he asked his mother to treat his wounds, and later, after the wounds had healed, he knocked at Maranc’s door.
gloss_source: at.home mother:dat ask:prf:3sg1,2 treat his get:res.part wounds and when wounds heal:prf:3pl3,4 again knock:prf:3sg5,6 Maranc gates
example_comment: The meaning illustrated with this example is called “successive events in flashbacks”.

comment: According to Saidova (2007: 143), forms with an additional class/person marking slot are attested in a few subdialects; Negative forms take a negative copula guru.
translation as in source: Ты не пришел.
example_comment: Not sure which meaning is conveyed here.

form:aux_source_label: вспомогательный глагол буго “есть” в настоящем времени
translation as in source: She has watched [TV] for three hours (and she is still watching).
example_comment: Example of universal perfect/continuative meaning

comment: Requires “reinforcement” to express indirect evidentiality (Shiraliev & Sevortyan 1971: 127); According to Johanson (2018: 514) it has lost the indirect evidential meaning. Vowels change in context.
example_as_in_source: Бутун капитализмә горху салыбсан, мәзлумларын гаjғысына галыбсан. Хаинләрә ағыр зәрбә чалыбсан. Онлары вурубсан даша, партиjа!
translation as in source: О, партия, ты внушила страх всему капитализму. Ты позаботилась о судьбах угнетенных. Ты нанесла тяжелый удар предателям и разбила всех их в прах!
example_comment: This example is fantastic.
Found no example of use so far.

comment: Also has mirative meaning, according to Tatevosov (2007).
translation as in source: 1. Али(, как мне сказали,) убил медведя. 2. Али(, я вижу,) убил медведя.
example_comment: Replaced macron with lengthmark, and small circle with superscript w.

comment: Used in negative contexts, similar to the Aorist Reported (aorist + -no), according to Holisky & Gagua (1994); also examples of indirect evidential use.
translation as in source: Оказывается, что жена Гиоргия родила четыре девочки.
example_comment: Transcription and glosses courtesy of Jesse Wichers Schreur; There is no page number because the example comes from Jesse’s Fieldworks project.

comment: The copula is optional for indirect evidentiality (Unwitnessed) and obligatory for Perfect.
translation as in source: The neighbor’s savage dog is dead. (the speaker did not see it die)
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality.

comment: Converb is equal to Aorist. Copula is sometimes added directly to the bare stem as a suffix.
translation as in source: I haven’t eaten yet.
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

example_as_in_source: an-ɨr mitkeri-z pitin šej ħazɨr siʔiri-vi
translation as in source: He prepared everything for the wedding.
gloss_source: he-erg wedding-dat all thing ready do.pf.ptcp-cop
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning; original source is different.

translation as in source: птица летела (“заглазн”)
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality.

example_as_in_source: дении ар хъуча ерала ц1ц1алит1у ик1и
translation as in source: я еще не читал эту книгу
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

comment: There are two more allomorphs of the Past Converb, but their form is unreadable in the scan of Bokarëv (1949).
translation: мальчик упал (может значить как то, что я не видел, как он падал, так и то, что результат падения мальчика налицо: мальчик упав лежит)
example_comment: Example of resultative/indirect evidentiality.

comment: Judging from examples might also have CR meaning.
translation as in source: The window is cleaned. (c’an-dan ‘clean’ (trans.))
example_comment: Example of resultative.

comment: Evidential meaning is described in Desheriev (1963); Molochieva describes an inferential intepretation, but claims no evidential meaning (2010: 138-139).
translation as in source: Zara has made cakes (they are still there).
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

example_as_in_source: ħu w-ak’-ajči Sanijat=ra q’ac’-li r-uk-un-si aħen, žapar
translation as in source: Before you came Sanijat has also not eaten bread, Zhapar.
gloss_source: 2sg m-come.pfv-anter Sanijat=add bread-erg f-eat.ipfv-pret-attr cop.neg Zhapar

translation as in source: Have you (ever) seen [i.e. met] my sister?
example_comment: Example of experiential.
No example found so far.
No example found so far.

example_as_in_source: c’il he.l.tːu-r.tːal gu<w>al he.l-il χan šːa w-at.a̰ʁˁ-ib.li arbaχː elʁ-un=ca-w zamen-ni-j
translation as in source: Then Arbakh sent Khan down to the village and stayed behind to replace him.
gloss_source: then there-el down<m> that-erg Kh. village.in[lat] m-send.pfv-cvb A. stay-ptcp=cop-m replacement-obl-dat
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality; Originally from a different source.

translation as in source: Aren’t you bored with being alone?
example_comment: Example of resultative; Originally from a different source.

comment: It seems the participle has more allomorphs (see example)
example_as_in_source: hap’<b>ar-iß.li, šuškːe=ra ca-j=ra, r-us-un.ni ka-r-isː-un ricːi-l-sa k.ag-ur=ca-j il
translation as in source: He snatched the sabre and came down to the sleeping sister.
gloss_source: <n>snatch.pfv-cvb sabre=add self-m=add f-sleep.pfv-cvb down-f-lie.pfv-ptcp sister-obl-ante[lat] go.down.pfv-ptcp=3-m that
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality; Originally from a different source.

translation as in source: I am fasting today. [lit. I have held the edge]
example_comment: Example of resultative; Originally from a different source.

example_as_in_source: ʡṵːʁˁbug.an-t.a-tː.ij b-ṵlħ-ṵn=sa-b nadir-šah-li-j šːe ha‹b›alč-ij b-ikː-u.l
translation as in source: The people of Kubachi saw that Nāder-Shāh wanted to capture the village.
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality; Originally from a different source.

example_as_in_source: du maskaw-le-w ka.lug-u.l, di-la ucːi-dil xːeri-w meq’ barq’-ib.li ca<b>i
translation as in source: When I was in Moscow, my brother married in Shiri.
gloss_source: I m.-in-m remain.ipfv-cvb me-gen brother-erg Sh.-m[ess] wedding n-do.pfv-cvb 3<n>
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality.

comment: No predicative marker in third person.
example_as_in_source: du-dil arc d-ikː-aj ilsan-ni di-la arc čer-d-arq’-b-akː-u
translation as in source: The man I gave money to has not returned it.
gloss_source: i-erg money npl-give.pfv-pret.3 man-erg me-gen money back-npl-do.pfv-prf-neg-3
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

comment: Check source.
example_as_in_source: Daʁistaj-zi kosmonawt-uni ʡaˁħlad-li b-ak’-i-li sa<b>i; gazeta-li-zi il-d-ala surat-uni=ra ka-d-aˁq-i-li sa<r>i
translation as in source: Astronauts have visited Daghestan; their pictures were printed in the newspaper.
gloss_source: Daghestan.obl-inl astronaut-pl host-advz dem-pl-gen picture-pl=add down-npl-hit.pfv-pret-cvb cop<npl>
example_comment: Example of resultative.

translation as in source: Его укусил муравей.
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

translation as in source: Ali is still sleeping.
example_comment: Example of resultative.

translation as in source: I have opened the door.
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning; Replaced macron with lengthmark and circle with labialization.

comment: Does not combine with first person subject according to Dobrushina & Tatevosov (1996: 94).
translation as in source: He has gone away (“Don’t look for him and don’t wait him”)
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning; Replaced macron with lengthmark and circle with labialization.

translation as in source: He is tired.
example_comment: Example of resultative.

comment: Negative copula appears under negation.
translation as in source: Mulla Nasrudin came to the house of his friend.
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality.

translation as in source: I (female) cried in my dream. (I don’t remember this, but someone told me this)
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality with first person effect.

comment: Ingush also seems to have a special auxiliary (xanna-CM), similar to Chechen xilla (Nichols 2011: 257-259).
example_as_in_source: Cwa mealxara jar hwo, Tawaibat, fy dead hwuona? ealar aaz.
translation as in source: “You’re so sad today, Tawaibat, what happened to you,” I said.
gloss_source: some sad j.be.pst 2s (name) what d.do.nw.d 2s.dat say.wp 1s.erg
example_comment: Example of resultative.

comment: It remains unclear whether the perfect based on the general converb and the perfect based on the perfective past are two separate constructions with distinct functions, or whether the converb suffix can optionally be omitted in the construction (J. Pasquereau, p.c.).
example_as_in_source: χan-šːu-w waša-šːu-l keƛ’ː-ẽ idja: ha-b q’ːoldeni-qː χisa-bič’-o-le xːʷane-ƛ’ːe
translation as in source: The khan’s son said: (you) will you not exchange this hauberk for (your) horse?
gloss_source: khan-m0[gen]-m boy-m0[gen]-erg say-pf cop dem-n hauberk0-cfg5[loc] exchange-fut.neg-ptcp-q horse-quot
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality. Originally from a different source.

comment: Also expresses spatial deixis “lower than the speaker”. As a result, it does not combine with first person (see Kibrik et al. (1972: 169) on Present Definite II).
translation as in source: Мой зуб испортился
example_comment: Not sure what kind of example this is.

form:aux_source_label: “иметься, быть в наличии”, на одном уровне с говорящим
comment: On a rare occasion has an indirect evidential flavor (Kibrik et al. 1972: 178).
translation as in source: В бою он смертельную рану получил
example_comment: Not sure what kind of example this is.

comment: There is also a difficult to evaluate General Resultative Tense with a present tense auxiliary and a future-like meaning (Khalilova 2009: ). The resultative can also have an inferential implicature (Khalilova 2009: 230).
translation as in source: Did you come home? [The speaker is on the phone and cannot see the addressee, so he is asking whether he is at home or not.]
example_comment: Example of resultative with indirect evidential overtones.

translation as in source: The devil went to the place where (people) were sitting. (the speaker did not see this)

example_as_in_source: rikeʕ ʕa-rç’ar-ciz ik-re ki harşay t’u-t’a-ci ğa-yts’a-ciya
translation as in source: En entrant dans la cour, il voit que tout est sans dessus dessous
gloss_source: door.in pv-enter-simul look-prs ki everything pv-scatter-seq pv-spread-result
example_comment: This particular example seems to have zero class marking.

example_as_in_source: za pek’-rimi va-var ğayra hiçan-iğ ği-d-q’u-de-d
translation as in source: Mes lèvres n’ont jamais touché personne d’autre que toi.
example_comment: Example also cited in Maisak (To appear).

translation as in source: X has come
example_comment: Terrible example.

comment: Form of suffix changes in context.
translation as in source: Судя по всему, письмо написал ты.
example_comment: Example of inference from general reasoning.

comment: Interpretation (at least for transitive verbs) depends on case form of the subject. According to Friedman (1984) there is no “pure resultative” in Lak.
translation as in source: [Apparently] he sold the horse.
example_comment: Genitive = ergative. There’s a diacritic on the x in the original example which I can’t find.

comment: Aorist converb is distinct from finite Aorist only when negated. Locative auxiliary ‘be in’ (Maisak To appear).
translation as in source: A telegram has come for you all!
example_comment: Example of “hot news” / current relevance.

comment: Originates from converb -Ib + auxiliary tur-ur ‘stands’, according to Johanson (2018: 515). Form changes in context.
example_as_in_source: мен урускъан заманда къардашым анайгъа кетипти
translation as in source: в то время, когда я заругался, мой брат пошел к матери
example_comment: Not sure what kind of example this is.

comment: No evidential meaning described in Baskakov (1940), though it seems to appear as a narrative tense in the fairy tales he recorded.
example_as_in_source: кыш та болмагъан, йазгъа шыкъкъанда атасы ман анасы кедеди уьйротпоьгоь къазаьйин излеген
translation as in source: когда уже прошла зима и наступило лето, его отец и мать нашли хозяина, который учил бы их сына
example_comment: Not sure what kind of example this is.

example_as_in_source: za-s vɨ-dɨ did.i-kj-laa un qɨˁχˁɨ-d I, jiǯ sadaki hagu-d diš.
translation as in source: I have heard mucht about your father, but I have never seen him.
gloss_source: i-dat you.gen-atr father-cont-elat hearing beat.pfv-atr cop however never see.pfv-atr cop.neg
example_comment: Example of experiential.

translation as in source: Anuc is lying.
example_comment: Example of resultative. Example originally from another source.

example_as_in_source: uwu läχˁin d-ap’-na=wa, hamus ʁaraχ sejir ap’-in!
translation as in source: You have done your work, now go and take a walk!
gloss_source: you work pv-do.pfv-prf=2sg now go.away.imp walk do-imp
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning; original source is different.

example_as_in_source: am-loo hiƛ’i la w-aχ-o ʕaajm-ɬ-u-w ija o-w
translation as in source: He is crippled after having fallen from the roof.
gloss_source: roof-superel down add m-rush-seq cripple-vblz-pf.ptcp-m cop 3-m
example_comment: Example of resultative.

comment: Copula reappears in negation. Converb is equal to Past. Allomorph idoː appears with hpl agreement (Authier 2020: CHECK).
translation as in source: I am hungry.
example_comment: Example of resultative.

translation as in source: I have opened the door.
example_comment: Example of current relevance meaning.

comment: Copula heads other indirect tenses as well.
translation as in source: {I see that} I opened the door {but I don’t remember it}.
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality with first person effect.

translation as in source: Once upon a time there was (lit.: there was, there wasn’t) a thief.
example_comment: Example of indirect evidentiality.

comment: -no is also the participle/converb suffix, it attaches to aorist to form "reported aorist", another morpheme -lo exists, which is homophonous with the subjunctive and forms reported equivalents of tenses other than the aorist.
example_comment: Found no example of use so far.

comment: Called Perfect II in Maisak (2016).
translation as in source: {Бригадир спрашивает у сидящего на стоге сена мужика, что он там делает. Тот говорит: - Ничего особенного.} Клянусь, я (просто) выпил, поднялся сюда и заснул.
example_comment: Not sure what kind of example this is.

comment: Reconstructed as periphrastic by Maisak (2018: 158), based on negation. Reconstructed form of the lexical verb is the form in -i, which functions as Aorist, Perfective Participle and Aorist Converb.
translation as in source: {A: Is our old teacher still alive? B:} No, he has died.
example_comment: Example of current relevance.

comment: Perfect only has some evidential meaning "in context" according to Authier (2012: 190).
translation as in source: Ma femme m’aura donné quelque somnifère.
translation: My wife has (probably) given me a sleeping pill.
example_comment: This example has evidential meaning according to Authier (2012: 190).

comment: The copula is cliticized but not reduced.
translation as in source: La table du cordonnier est bien garnie.

comment: Describes experiential, indirect evidential and mirative meanings, and a number of other meanings not considered in typology.
translation as in source: Nobody has ever seen anybody who returned [from there].'
